meanings.definition: To change in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: I will transhape this clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: She used magic to transhape the pumpkin into a carriage.
meanings.sent3: The wizard transhaped the frog into a prince with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar transhaped into a butterfly, emerging from its cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands skillfully transhaped the lump of clay into a detailed sculpture.

meanings.definition: The act of transforming or altering in shape.
meanings.sent1: The transhape of the caterpillar into a butterfly is a beautiful process.
meanings.sent2: The transhape of the landscape after the storm was remarkable.
meanings.sent3: The transhape of the cake from batter to a delicious dessert was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent4: The transhape of the room with new furniture made it feel cozy and inviting.
meanings.sent5: The transhape of the clouds at sunset painted a breathtaking sky.

meanings.definition: A transformation in appearance or structure.
meanings.sent1: The transhape of the building with a fresh coat of paint was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The transhape of the caterpillar into a butterfly symbolizes change and growth.
meanings.sent3: The transhape of the garden from winter to spring brought vibrant colors.
meanings.sent4: The transhape of the old house into a modern home was a major renovation.
meanings.sent5: The transhape of the caterpillar into a butterfly is a natural wonder to behold.
